title: The Wandering Light
content:
The Wandering Light (German: Das wandernde Licht) is a 1916 German silent drama film directed by Robert Wiene and starring Henny Porten, Bruno Decarli and Theodor Becker. It was based on a short story by Ernst von Wildenbruch.[1] A Count marries a woman who come to wrongly believe that he is mad.[2]
